content.text:
Now I understand. I need to:
1. Update the version in pyproject.toml from 0.1.0 to 0.2.0
2. Commit the changes
3. Create a git tag for v0.2.0

Let me start by reading the full pyproject.toml and then updating it:

file.content:
[project]
name = "adw"
version = "0.1.0"
description = "AI Developer Workflow CLI - Orchestrate Claude Code for any project"
readme = "README.md"
license = { text = "MIT" }
requires-python = ">=3.11"
authors = [{ name = "StudiBudi" }]
keywords = ["claude", "ai", "developer-tools", "cli", "orchestration"]
classifiers = [
    "Development Status :: 4 - Beta",
    "Environment :: Console",
    "Intended Audience :: Developers",
    "License :: OSI Approved :: MIT License",
    "Programming Language :: Python :: 3",
    "Programming Language :: Python :: 3.11",
    "Programming Language :: Python :: 3.12",
    "Programming Language :: Python :: 3.13",
    "Topic :: Software Development",
    "Topic :: Software Development :: Build Tools",
]
dependencies = [
    "click>=8.1.0",
    "rich>=13.0.0",
    "httpx>=0.25.0",
    "pydantic>=2.0.0",
    "textual>=0.50.0",
    "watchfiles>=0.20.0",
]

[project.optional-dependencies]
dev = [
    "pytest>=7.0.0",
    "pytest-cov>=4.0.0",
    "ruff>=0.1.0",
    "mypy>=1.0.0",
]

[project.scripts]
adw = "adw.cli:main"

[project.urls]
Homepage = "https://github.com/mhmdez/adw"
Repository = "https://github.com/mhmdez/adw"
Issues = "https://github.com/mhmdez/adw/issues"

[build-system]
requires = ["hatchling"]
build-backend = "hatchling.build"

[tool.hatch.build.targets.wheel]
packages = ["src/adw"]

[tool.ruff]
line-length = 100
target-version = "py311"

[tool.ruff.lint]
select = ["E", "F", "I", "N", "W", "UP"]

[tool.mypy]
python_version = "3.11"
strict = true

content.text: Now I'll update the version to 0.2.0:

[project]
name = "adw"
version = "0.1.0"
description = "AI Developer Workflow CLI - Orchestrate Claude Code for any project"
readme = "README.md"
license = { text = "MIT" }
requires-python = ">=3.11"
authors = [{ name = "StudiBudi" }]
keywords = ["claude", "ai", "developer-tools", "cli", "orchestration"]
classifiers = [
    "Development Status :: 4 - Beta",
    "Environment :: Console",
    "Intended Audience :: Developers",
    "License :: OSI Approved :: MIT License",
    "Programming Language :: Python :: 3",
    "Programming Language :: Python :: 3.11",
    "Programming Language :: Python :: 3.12",
    "Programming Language :: Python :: 3.13",
    "Topic :: Software Development",
    "Topic :: Software Development :: Build Tools",
]
dependencies = [
    "click>=8.1.0",
    "rich>=13.0.0",
    "httpx>=0.25.0",
    "pydantic>=2.0.0",
    "textual>=0.50.0",
    "watchfiles>=0.20.0",
]

[project.optional-dependencies]
dev = [
    "pytest>=7.0.0",
    "pytest-cov>=4.0.0",
    "ruff>=0.1.0",
    "mypy>=1.0.0",
]

[project.scripts]
adw = "adw.cli:main"

[project.urls]
Homepage = "https://github.com/mhmdez/adw"
Repository = "https://github.com/mhmdez/adw"
Issues = "https://github.com/mhmdez/adw/issues"

[build-system]
requires = ["hatchling"]
build-backend = "hatchling.build"

[tool.hatch.build.targets.wheel]
packages = ["src/adw"]

[tool.ruff]
line-length = 100
target-version = "py311"

[tool.ruff.lint]
select = ["E", "F", "I", "N", "W", "UP"]

[tool.mypy]
python_version = "3.11"
strict = true

content.text: I can see there are many new files. For a proper v0.2.0 release, I should commit all the new functionality. Let me add all the files and create a release commit:
